newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: HOOGOVENS, KLOCKNER RESHUFFLE JOINT INTERESTS.
newsitem.headline: HOOGOVENS, KLOCKNER RESHUFFLE JOINT INTERESTS.

text.p: Steel and aluminium group Hoogovens NV said on Wednesday it expected to reach agreement with German counterpart Klockner on the rejigging of their joint interests.
"Negotiations...on the rearrangement of the interest of the two companies in several joint holdings have now reached a stage where agreement is expected to be reached," Hoogovens said.

It said the rearrangement of holdings in three jointly-owned subsidiaries, ODS/Hoogovens Handel, Namascor and Montana Bausysteme, fitted with the strategy of the two companies to concentrate on core activities.

Under the reshuffle, Hoogovens will gain full ownership of Dutch steel services company Namascor and Swiss-based construction panelling maker Montana, in which it currently holds stakes of 50 percent and 49 percent respectively.
In turn Hoogovens will sell its 49 percent shareholding in ODS/Hoogovens Handel BV, a Dutch metals and engineering products trader, to Klockner.

Hoogovens said the Namascor service centre, where hot-rolled steel is cut into sheets, and steel roof and wall panels maker Montana fitted well with its core business of producing and servicing steel and aluminium.
